description: Middle English celidoine, Old French celidoine, French chélidoine, from Latin chelīdonia, from chelīdonius (“relating to the swallow”), from Ancient Greek χελιδόνιος (khelidónios), χελιδών (khelidṓn). It was traditionally supposed to flower when the swallows appeared, and to perish when they departed.

definitionGroups.group: Either of two not closely related flowering plants:

entries.meaning: lesser celandine (Ficaria verna, formerly Ranunculus ficaria)
